result.execSummary:
All charges against Deven B Heimes in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deven B Heimes is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deven B Heimes

Return to sender - Refused.  Reminder Notice

9:46 AM Defendant Deven B Heimes not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant does not appear. 
State moves to dismiss this matter. 
BTC: State's motion to dismiss is granted.

2:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Deven B Heimes in court. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a bail bond hearing. 
Defendant provided court with RCAP test results from today's date. 
Defendant states he is seeking treatment. States he will obtain counsel. 
State will defer to the court regarding RCAP violation. 
BTC: Matter set over for a status as previously scheduled for 8/30/22.
Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's Notice of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements
State's Notice of Intent to Introduce Certified Public Records without Extrinsic Evidence
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:28 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Deven B Heimes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Deven B Heimes. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
